t: Job 27
Moreover*p Job continued his parable, and said,
As*p God liveth, who hath taken away my judgment; and the Almighty, who hath vexed my soul;
All*p the while my breath is in me, and the spirit of God is in my nostrils;
My*p lips shall not speak wickedness, nor my tongue utter deceit.
God*p forbid that I should justify you: till I die I will not remove mine integrity from me.
My*p righteousness I hold fast, and will not let it go: my heart shall not reproach me so long as I live.
Let*p mine enemy be as the wicked, and he that riseth up against me as the unrighteous.
For*p what is the hope of the hypocrite, though he hath gained, when God taketh away his soul?
Will*p God hear his cry when trouble cometh upon him?
Will*p he delight himself in the Almighty? will he always call upon God?
I*p will teach you by the hand of God: that which is with the Almighty will I not conceal.
Behold,*p all ye yourselves have seen it; why then are ye thus altogether vain?
This*p is the portion of a wicked man with God, and the heritage of oppressors, which they shall receive of the Almighty.
If*p his children be multiplied, it is for the sword: and his offspring shall not be satisfied with bread.
Those*p that remain of him shall be buried in death: and his widows shall not weep.
Though*p he heap up silver as the dust, and prepare raiment as the clay;
He*p may prepare it, but the just shall put it on, and the innocent shall divide the silver.
He*p buildeth his house as a moth, and as a booth that the keeper maketh.
The*p rich man shall lie down, but he shall not be gathered: he openeth his eyes, and he is not.
Terrors*p take hold on him as waters, a tempest stealeth him away in the night.
The*p east wind carrieth him away, and he departeth: and as a storm hurleth him out of his place.
For*p God shall cast upon him, and not spare: he would fain flee out of his hand.
Men*p shall clap their hands at him, and shall hiss him out of his place.
